prs.title: 🚀 Version packages
prs.truncated_body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.

prs.title: [chore] Remove high cardinality execution tag
prs.truncated_body:
This is a possible source of a memory leak that I'm tracking down.

As a matter of best practice, high cardinality labels (such as execution ID) should be avoided since they can increase memory utilization of our OTeL backend and significantly increase the cost of storing the metric.

prs.title: Correction to PR #93
prs.truncated_body:
This was an important part of the block pruning fix I'd intended to make in PR #93, somehow it got left out. 

The other line where referenceBlock is used is irrelevant for production environments, it's only for tests where blockchains can be shorter than the finality depth.  This is the one that matters for production.

prs.title: refactor(test): continue cleanup of /libraries test suite
prs.truncated_body:
This PR continues the refactor of the `/libraries` test folder as part of the ongoing effort to standardize structure, documentation, and formatting across the test suite.

Some files were already refactored in [#16103](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16103), and the remaining ones are completed in this PR, except for Storage.t.sol, which will be refactored in a later PR.

#

commits.message:
refactor(test): improve EOA test structure and documentation

- consolidate test initialization into EOA_TestInit contract
- rename test contract to EOA_isSenderEOA_Test to follow the naming convention
- add @title and @notice tags to test contract

prs.title: refactor(test): continue cleanup of /cannon test suite
prs.truncated_body:
This PR continues the refactor of the `/cannon` test folder as part of the ongoing effort to standardize structure, documentation, and formatting across the test suite.

Some files were already refactored in [#16211](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16211), and the remaining ones are completed in this PR.

### Common changes applied where applicable:
- Extracted shared setup

commits.message:
refactor(test): improve PreimageOracle test structure and documentation

- consolidate test initialization into PreimageOracle_TestInit contract
- organize individual test functions into separate contracts inheriting from TestInit
- group tests not directly tied to a base contract function or are testing multiple functions into PreimageOracle_Unclassified_Test
- refactor test function names to follow naming convention
- reorder test functions to match the order of definitions in the base contract
- add @title and @notice tags to test contracts
- ensure comment stay within 100 character limit

prs.title: quic: allocate conn after decrypt in handle_initial
prs.truncated_body: This PR primarily addresses https://github.com/firedancer-io/firedancer/issues/5248 .  It refactors handle_v1_initial so that we don't allocate a connection too early, where it might need to be torn down anyway due to a decryption failure. It also closes a very low-sev attack vector that is currently open: If client A has an open connection that is still handshaking (server retains the initial enc

Thank you to Italo Casas for reporting this bug

prs.title: simd-0178: static syscalls (update)
prs.truncated_body:
Amending https://github.com/firedancer-io/firedancer/pull/3711

As a follow up of the discussion in https://github.com/solana-foundation/solana-improvement-documents/pull/178, we decided to no longer have an array of syscalls but keep using murmur32(syscall-name).

prs.title: repair: improvements
prs.truncated_body:
Series of repair improvements, mostly simplifying what we have
- takes response rate by peer from ~50% -> 95% (could later track rndtrip latency)
- benchmarked catchup handful of times::
       - pre-commit: takes > 400ms / slot to execute from snapshot to first turbine including repair stalls
       - post: takes ~200ms/slot to execute from snapshot to first turbine inclusing repair stalls
A

commits.message:
repair: improvements and simplifications to repair request logic
  * removing needed table and combining duplicate detection
  * limiting number of repair requests per after_credit iteration
  * repairing sequentially by slot, some timeout adjustment
  * round-robin request active peers

prs.title: Simplify StarkNetBitcoinDepositor for Direct StarkGate Integration
prs.truncated_body:
## Overview

This PR simplifies the `StarkNetBitcoinDepositor` contract by removing unnecessary state management and aligning it with the actual StarkGate bridge interface requirements. The refactor reduces complexity while maintaining full functionality for Bitcoin-to-StarkNet bridging via tBTC.

## Motivation

The original implementation included fee management and state tracking features

commits.message:
refactor: Simplify StarkNetBitcoinDepositor contract by removing unused variables and events

- Removed starkNetTBTCToken, l1ToL2MessageFee, and feeBuffer variables along with their associated events and functions.
- Updated the TBTCBridgedToStarkNet event to include the sender address and fee.
- Introduced estimateFee function to retrieve the estimated fee from the StarkGate bridge.
- Adjusted finalizeDeposit function to use the new fee estimation logic.
- Enhanced initialization and bridging logic for clarity and efficiency.

refactor: Update StarkNetBitcoinDepositor contract and add mock implementations

- Reformatted event declarations for better readability.
- Removed unused parameters from the initialize function, simplifying the contract.
- Introduced MockBridgeForStarkNet and MockStarkGateBridge for testing purposes.
- Updated tests to reflect changes in the deposit function and fee estimation logic.
- Enhanced integration tests for better coverage of StarkNet interactions.

fix: Update deposit key calculation and adjust mock deposit parameters

- Changed deposit key calculation in MockTBTCBridge to use abi.encode instead of abi.encodePacked.
- Updated deposit amount and treasury fee in MockTBTCBridgeWithSweep for accurate testing.
- Modified return types in MockTBTCVault to align with expected data types.
- Added functionality to set expected deposit key in StarkNetBitcoinDepositor tests for improved test accuracy.

prs.title: Revert Jito-Solana WorkingBankEntry changes
prs.truncated_body:
#### Problem
Jito-Solana unnecessarily uses a custom data structure between poh service + broadcast stage, which makes rebases more difficult. This custom data structure is not needed and can go away.

#### Summary of Changes
Reverts WorkingBankEntry to Agave upstream.

prs.title: Visual Studio Project fixes (June 2025)
prs.truncated_body:
issues fixed in this PR:
* rust bridge was not build anymore
* circular dependencies in .x files
* "vNext" was broken when there is no "WIP" host env
* "clean" didn't work for Rust, leading to linking with stale libraries when switching Rust features

commits.message:
fix Visual Studio Project:
* rust bridge was not build anymore
* circular dependencies in .x files
* "vNext" was broken when there is no "WIP" env
* "clean" didn't work for rust, leading to linking with stale libraries when switching Rust features

prs.title: ci: update PR title validation to accept revert titles and move skip changelog to description
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary
- Accept "Revert ..." titles from GitHub's revert functionality in pr-title-check.yml
- Remove [skip changelog] prefix support from PR titles 
- Update changelog.yml to check for [skip changelog] in PR description instead of title
- Update CONTRIBUTING.md to document both changes

## Test plan

prs.title: Remove gzip middleware from API server
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged
Previously the gzip middleware added gzip header to all responses, which breaks gRPC support. Compression can be handled more cleanly somewhere upstream if needed, meaning this middleware is not necessary and should be removed.

## How this works
The `gziphandler.GzipHandler` wrapper is removed from the API server setup. The import was removed and `go.mod` and `go.

commits.message: Remove gzip middleware from API server

prs.title: Clarify field names for simplex p2p messages
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Small nit that was not found in the last merged [simplex pr](https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/pull/3976). Quorum certificates can be notarizations or finalizations so the old field name doesn't make sense. Similarly, changed names for other fields to `block_header` & `metadata` for more clarity.

## How this works

## How this was tested

## Need to be

prs.title: Move HTTP2 routing information into headers
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Modifying the http2 `:path` is hacky because it's typically a read-only value, and supporting other tools like postman/grpcurl require more hacks where we have to keep injecting this value

## How this works

Moves the chain id information into an http header, which tooling generally has access to read/write to

## How this was tested

xsvm e2e test

## Ne

commits.message:
move http2 routing information into headers

prs.title: Add new timer and counter methods to metrics facade
prs.truncated_body:
This PR implements issue(s) https://github.com/Consensys/maru/issues/97

In this PR
- Add counter and timer Factory that can create meters with common tags. This is useful in cases where the timers or counters only differ by tags. eg: Timers in an Engine API client implementation. There will be one timer provider which will create timers for each method. See example in unit test.
- Add Timer I

commits.message: Add new timer and counter methods to metrics facade
Review comments and refactor DynamicTag timer capture

prs.title: :sparkles: Update pallet benchmarks to use v2 syntax
prs.truncated_body:
### What does it do?

Updates pallets to use the new `v2` benchmarks syntax. This mainly involves replacing the old declarative macros with the procedural macros provided by the `v2` module.

### What important points should reviewers know?

Depending on the benchmark implementation, some were refactored to use `#[extrinsic_call]`  for the actual method being benchmarked while some others no

commits.message: refactor parachain staking benchmarks to v2

prs.title: [v0.31.1-rc.1] Starts release candidate
prs.truncated_body:
### Description

Start the release candidate process for version `v0.31.1-rc.1`.
This PR will merge any changes on `master` into `release-candidate` branch.

**The main objective of this release is to validate the working condition of the React Native `v0.72` build on the App Store.** This will probably not result in a public release, as more features are expected on `v0.32.0`.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #648 from HathorNetwork/release-candidate

[0.31.0] Merge Release candidate into `release`

feat: rc on bump version script (#652)

fix: sequential nano contract register fails on second one (#656)

* fix: stop using useMemo for ncToAccept

* refactor: actually use useMemo, but pass ncAddress as a dependency

Merge pull request #657 from HathorNetwork/chore/sync-with-master

[v0.31.0] Sync `master` with `release`

fix: we should confirm that the user wants to decline the nc transaction (#661)

* fix: we should confirm that the user wants to decline the nc transaction

* feat: custom hook for listening to back actions + implementation in more screens

* fix: infinite recursion on sign oracle data

* fix: infinite recursion on create token

* feat: added missing modals for rejecting a tx in createtoken and sign oracle data

* refactor: unused import

fix: White bar below custom network (#674)

prs.title: chore(release): v2.66.0
prs.truncated_body:
## v2.66.0

### Added

-  Extended `setPayableAmount` function in ContractExecuteTransaction, by allowing the user to pass a HbarUnit as optional second parameter. [#3129](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-js/pull/3129)


### Fixed
- Prevented unintended removal of transaction type registrations by disabling tree shaking for modules with critical side effects, ensuring proper runti

commits.message:
chore: Bumped proto/cryptography package versions

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>

prs.title: chore(fix): Disabling `sideEffects` from the tree shaking
prs.truncated_body:
### Descriptipn
This PR disables tree shaking for specific modules that register transaction types via side-effectful calls (e.g., `TRANSACTION_REGISTRY.set()`). These registration calls are required at runtime but were previously being removed by tree shaking due to the `"sideEffects": false` setting in `package.json`.

### Context

Webpack tree shaking removes unused code based on import/ex

commits.message:
fix: Disabling sideEffects from the tree shaking

Signed-off-by: ivaylogarnev-limechain <ivaylo.garnev@limechain.tech>
